previous.name: The Decline of the True Teaching (3rd)

segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5
16. The True Teaching
157. Inappropriate Talk

segments.pli: “Pañcannaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalānaṃ kathā dukkathā puggale puggalaṃ upanidhāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are certain topics that are inappropriate to talk about, taking into consideration which specific one of five people you are talking to.
What five?
It’s inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith.
It’s inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics.
It’s inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning.
It’s inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity.
It’s inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, assaddhassa saddhākathā dukkathā?
segments.en: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith?

segments.pli: Assaddho, bhikkhave, saddhākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When an unfaithful person is spoken to about faith they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, saddhāsampadaṃ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Not seeing that faith in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that faith brings.
That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, dussīlassa sīlakathā dukkathā?
segments.en: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics?

segments.pli: Dussīlo, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When an unethical person is spoken to about ethics they lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sīlasampadaṃ attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Not seeing that ethical conduct in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that ethical conduct brings.
That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, appassutassa bāhusaccakathā dukkathā?
segments.en: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning?

segments.pli: Appassuto, bhikkhave, bāhusaccakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When an unlearned person is spoken to about learning they lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sutasampadaṃ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Not seeing that learning in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that learning brings.
That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, maccharissa cāgakathā dukkathā?
segments.en: And why is it inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity?

segments.pli: Maccharī, bhikkhave, cāgakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When an stingy person is spoken to about generosity they lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, cāgasampadaṃ attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Not seeing that generosity in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that generosity brings.
That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā?
segments.en: And why is it inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom?

segments.pli: Duppañño, bhikkhave, paññākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When a witless person is spoken to about wisdom they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, paññāsampadaṃ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Not seeing that wisdom in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that wisdom brings.
That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ puggalānaṃ kathā dukkathā puggale puggalaṃ upanidhāya.
segments.en: These are topics that are inappropriate to talk about, taking into consideration which specific one of five people you are talking to.

segments.pli: Pañcannaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalānaṃ kathā sukathā puggale puggalaṃ upanidhāya.
segments.en: There are certain topics that are appropriate to talk about, taking into consideration which specific one of five people you are talking to.
What five?
It’s appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith.
It’s appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct.
It’s appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning.
It’s appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity.
It’s appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, saddhassa saddhākathā sukathā?
segments.en: And why is it appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith?

segments.pli: Saddho, bhikkhave, saddhākathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When a faithful person is spoken to about faith they don’t lose their temper, they don’t get annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, saddhāsampadaṃ attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing that faith in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that faith brings.
That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, sīlavato sīlakathā sukathā?
segments.en: And why is it appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct?

segments.pli: Sīlavā, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When an ethical person is spoken to about ethical conduct they don’t lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sīlasampadaṃ attani samanupassati, labhati ca tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing that ethical conduct in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that ethical conduct brings.
That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, bahussutassa bāhusaccakathā sukathā?
segments.en: And why is it appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning?

segments.pli: Bahussuto, bhikkhave, bāhusaccakathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When a learned person is spoken to about learning they don’t lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sutasampadaṃ attani samanupassati, labhati ca tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing that learning in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that learning brings.
That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, cāgavato cāgakathā sukathā?
segments.en: And why is it appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity?

segments.pli: Cāgavā, bhikkhave, cāgakathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When a generous person is spoken to about generosity they don’t lose their temper …
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, cāgasampadaṃ attani samanupassati, labhati ca tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing that generosity in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that generosity brings.
That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity.

segments.pli: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, paññavato paññākathā sukathā?
segments.en: And why is it appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom?

segments.pli: Paññavā, bhikkhave, paññākathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: When a wise person is spoken to about wisdom they don’t lose their temper, they don’t get annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
Why is that?

segments.pli: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, paññāsampadaṃ attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing that wisdom in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that wisdom brings.
That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ puggalānaṃ kathā sukathā puggale puggalaṃ upanidhāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are topics that are appropriate to talk about, taking into consideration which specific one of five people you are talking to.”
